results.title: A Doll's house: by Henrik Ibsen
results.creator_credit: Elkins Productions, Hillard Elkins and Patrick Garland
results.brief_description: Ibsen’s feminist play set is Norway depicts Nora Helmer (Claire Bloom), a woman struggling for independence within her marriage, and against her husband’s will (played by Anthony Hopkins). In the face of male obstinacy and arrogance she sets off in search of her own life and destiny and breaks the shackles which have persisted in treating her as if she were a doll. Cast includes Denholm Elliot, Ralph Richardson and Edith Evans. Another version of Ibsens’s play, directed by Joseph Losey was released in the same year starring Jane Fonda and David Werner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elkins Productions, Hillard Elkins and Patrick Garland

results.title: A Doll's House
results.creator_credit: World Film Services, Les Films de la Boetie and Joseph Losey
results.brief_description: Henrik Ibsen’s stage classic of Nora, a Norwegian girl who struggles to make a success of a doomed marriage. The film chronicles Nora’s married life to Torvald, from her initial excitement of spending her life with him to the realisation that the marriage is a failure. In “A Doll’s House”, Nora’s affections and dependence move from her father to her husband. Through a number of personal experiences she realises that she has accepted without question the rules and conventions regarding a wife and woman’s conduct, that she has acted like a doll child then a doll wife, not asked or persuaded to have opinions and judgement. Stars Jane Fonda, David Warner and Trevor Howard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: World Film Services, Les Films de la Boetie and Joseph Losey

results.title: A Dog of Flanders
results.creator_credit: DeLuxe Cinemascope, TCF, Associated producers, Robert B Radnitz and James B. Clark
results.brief_description: 12 year old Nello lives with his grandfather near Antwerp. They manage to eke a living by delivering milk into the city. Nello dreams of becoming a famous artist like Ruebens and is able to satisfy his interest by befriending a painter. One day while returning from a delivery Nello discovers a dog, left for dead in the bushes. They take him home and restore his health. The owner soon turns up to reclaim his dog, fortunately he is unsuccessful. This is only the start to Nello’s troubles as his grandfather dies, leaving Nello without enough money to look after himself, let alone the dog. A touching story that will appeal to the whole family. Starring David Ladd, Donald Crisp and Theodore Bikel. Based on the novel by Ouida.

results.title: A Dog's world
results.creator_credit: Wall to Wall Television, Channel 4, Louise Jones and Gary Johnstone
results.brief_description: This program looks at the evolution of the dog as a companion animal and the adaptions dogs have made from their wolf-like existence as pack animals. We see how they use their keen sense of smell, hearing, and sensitivity to movement, combined with their territorial and protective behaviours in order to coexist happily with their human families.

results.title: A Divided world
results.brief_description: The film captures the harshness of the struggle for existence between the stoats, foxes, hares, and owls in the dark cold of a winter’s night in a Swedish forest. Photographed by Arne Sucksdorff.
results.description: The film captures the harshness of the struggle for existence between the stoats, foxes, hares, and owls in the dark cold of a winter’s night in a Swedish forest. Photographed by Arne Sucksdorff.

results.title: A Disney Christmas gift
results.brief_description: Presenting a gift-wrapped collection of Christmas treasures - favourite holiday scenes from Walt Disney’s best loved animated classics and cartoons. Join Mickey Mouse and his friends, and enjoy some of the brightest, most colourful moments on film, like Bambi and Thumper frolicking in the snow, and magical moments with Cinderella and her fairy godmother! From snowflakes and sleigh bells to Christmas toys and merry wishes, this is a very special gift, a glittering package spilling over with Yuletide fun.

results.title: A Discussion in history
results.brief_description: Illustrates the technique of discussion as a method of teaching at senior high school level, and shows how a well-planned discussion may yield a deeper and clearer understanding of ideas. The subject of the french Revolution is introduced by the lecturer, who then leads the group in an unrehearsed discussion on various aspects of the subject.

results.title: A Disappearing trick (K)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from the book ” A Bear called Paddington”. Paddington puts on a magic show for the Brown Family, Mr. Gruber and Mr. Curry. After repeatedly annoying Mr. Curry in the course of his demonstration of magic tricks, Paddington decides it is time to disappear.
